question: Does an agency manager have to be licensed?
text:
Does an agency manager have to be licensed?
          
        
YES, all producer accounts including an Agency Manager needs to have 
an instate
 a resident license if residing in PA or a non-resident PA Health Producer License issued by the Pennsylvania Insurance Department. Agency Managers and brokers both have access to customer accounts and can submit applications and make plan selections on a customers behalf. It is important customers know they are working with a licensed health producer.
